SENT.plain: Cirrhotic cardiomyopathy designates a cardiac dysfunction, which includes reduced cardiac contractility with systolic and diastolic dysfunction, and presence of electrophysiological abnormalities in particular prolongation of the QT interval
Several pathophysiological mechanisms including reduced beta-receptor function seem involved in the autonomic and cardiac dysfunction
Cirrhotic cardiomyopathy can be revealed by tissue Doppler imaging but is best demasked by physical or pharmacological stress
Liver transplantation may revert cardiac dysfunction but surgery and shunt insertion may also aggravate the condition
Moreover, cirrhotic cardiomyopathy may contribute to heart failure after invasive procedures and to development of hepatic nephropathy as part of a cardiorenal syndrome
Whether beta-blockers have a deleterious effect in this clinical situation remains to be settled
